definition: to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: Thirdly, loan losses and write-off criteria are too strict and cumbersome.
sentences.chinese: 贷款损失的认定和核销标准过于严格和繁琐。

sentences.english: Notice that this entry is exactly the opposite of the entry as uncollectible.
sentences.chinese: 注意这个会计分录恰好与核销坏账的分录相反。

sentences.english: I. Strengthening the administration of distribution of verification and writing-off forms.
sentences.chinese: 加强对核销单发放环节的管理。

sentences.english: TNT limited cargo insured value no more than USD600 when cargo do not need single customs clearance.
sentences.chinese: 没有核销单TNT也无法对货物进行单独报关。

sentences.english: To perform a management method of before-verification-and-writing-off taxation reimbursement on companies of category A.
sentences.chinese: 对A类企业实行先预退税后核销的管理办法。

sentences.english: Must have Shouhui and the write off of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 必须是已收汇并经核销的货物。

sentences.english: One copy of Verification Certificate shall only be used for import payment once.
sentences.chinese: 一份核销单只可凭以办理一次付汇。

sentences.english: This Delay Reasons Report should be attached to the Expenses Report of business trip.
sentences.chinese: 本表请并同出差旅费报告书核销。

sentences.english: Been so, we began to prepare write-off information.
sentences.chinese: 等得到后，开始准备核销的资料。

definition: to pay a tax one has evaded/to pay an overdue tax
(accounting) to strike a balance/to reverse an entry/to write off
to claim a credit against/tax reduction
to settle a bill/to close an account
to set aside/to make provision for (capital requirements)
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
